New Records: Miami Heat suffered a 36-point blowout loss to the Utah Jazz, marking a humiliating start to the post-Jimmy Butler era.
Key Match Events: The Heat shot an abysmal 26% from 3-point range and 44% from the field, while the Jazz had 52% efficiency overall and 41% from deep.
The Jazz had a 57-32 advantage in rebounding.
Brice Sensabaugh led the Jazz with 34 points off the bench.
Tyler Herro added 15 points on shaky 4 of 12 shooting, while Bam Adebayo had 4 points and 8 rebounds.
Post-Match Reflections: The Heat organization has hit rock bottom, and the team is in a state of zero direction.
The Heat roster looks worse than their 7-25 opponent, and they have to rely on Pat Riley to work for the first time since 2019.
The team's morale is rock bottom, and it's getting even more difficult moving forward.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Heat play again on Monday to begin an extended west coast trip.
Tyler Herro stayed classy in a difficult situation, and the Heat season just got a lot less boring.
The West Coast Road Trip is the best thing that could happen to this team right now, as they discover their identity without Jimmy Butler.
Others: The article mentions various Twitter reactions to the game, including criticism of coach Erik Spoelstra and the Heat's front office.
